reviewText:
I got this from a greenlight bundle, and I must say I'm very happy with the game and the developer's response to issues I had with the game, making great improvements not long after I reported issues with the game. This is the kind of indie developer we need!

Regarding the game itself, it is as fun and satisfying as the trailer makes you believe. Controller support is near perfect (it would be better if moving through menus did not require mouse emulation, as that makes the mouse curser appear in the middle of the screen), jumping is precise and the amount of challenge is good enough.

This is a very short game, but the bonus levels and level editor feature allow some extra gameplay time if you want more. It's definitely worth your time, and the dev really deserves your money!

Pros

- Precise platforming
- Fun
- Fair puzzles
- level editor
- controller support works very well

Cons

- Short (no problem for me, but some people want longer games)
- music get repetitive after a while
- had the game crash before being patched (works great now)

reviewText:
This game is AWESOME!
AND YOU SHOULD GET IT NOW!

Seriously, this game has a very new concept which is very cool.

First the levels are easy. but get harder level by level. There are three sets of levels (?): Dawn, Day and Dusk, respectively. In each level, a new game mechanic is introduced, for example: trampolines, fans that push you around, poisons and MUCH more. also the lives change in each level.
The in-game music is around 2-3 minutes and loops when finished.
The most fun part is that there is a level editor! And you can submit your levels to the steam workshop, but it's very hard to learn and the instructions are not clear.
But im my opinion, 5$ price is too much for a game this short, but it's still worth every penny.
Can't wait to see more updates and level for this game.
I give this game a very good 8.5/10

reviewText: This game is actually really cool. Great idea and just mildly infuriating enough to stay interesting. Keep it up!
Fantastic Game! The Controls are sharp, the concept is neat, it has a good difficutly curve, and it's a great use of 5$!

I died exactly 734 before completing all levels including the bonus ones. The full price of the game is $4.99. That's approximately seven tenths of a cent per life. Seven the number which is a symbol of divine abundance. In Respawn Man you have an abundance of lives. Jesus only respawned once. ILLUMINATI CONFIRMED.


tl;dr: Yes.

For those weirdos who read:

This game is a deceptively simple looking puzzle platformer that's actually quite fun. I found myself dying a lot because I kept underestimating the levels and being hasty. Despite all my cursing and exclamations of BULLS**T!!"

reviewText:
This was an interesting game. Its a simple game about a man who defies death and becomes respawn man, a man who uses his own corpses to his advantage. But not all is as it appears when respawning infinitely means a life of pain and eternal suffering.

This game has a neat little story with a little hilarity and rhyme. It has easy controls and a red shirted fool, who is just abusing his time. Some of the later levels get hard, and it makes you want to break the shards. But any mistake, no matter how late, is always your fault in this grind.

I recommend this game to anyone who really wants to take a trip back to old 32 bit gaming and enjoy the catchy music and smooth difficulty curve level designs. Good job SolidPlasma.
Basically the budget version of Life goes on".\n\nBut a great one as I had a lot of fun with it. Sure
date: it was made with a cheap game maker software but I think the dev executed the idea pretty well.\n\nGraphics as well as sound are really bad and the controls need some polishing but you'll enjoy it anyways!"
